dialogue.raw_text: Well, you know now, so please tell me who you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you know my name -- it's Dyle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carson Dyle is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, he is. He was my brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your -- DYLE The army thinks he was killed in action by the Germans, but I think they did it -- Tex, Gideon and Scobie -- and your husband -- because he wouldn't go along with their scheme to steal the gold. I think he threatened to turn them in and they killed him. I'm trying to prove it. They think I'm working with them. But I'm not, and that's the truth. I'm on your side, Reggie -- please believe that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can I? You lied to me -- the way Charles did -- and after promising you wouldn't. Oh, I want to believe you, Peter... oh, but I can't call you that anymore, can I? It will take me a while to get used to your new name -- which I don't even know yet. What is it? (pause) Aren't you going to tell me? (pause) Hello -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- PHONE CABINS As REGGIE steps out of her cabin and starts looking in the others. They are all occupied except one and she looks inside it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- EMPTY CABIN The receiver hangs by its cord, swinging back and forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- REGGIE As she looks at it, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SCOBIE stand together, waiting for the elevator, SCOBIE clearly holding a gun in the pocket of his raincoat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The self-service elevator doors open, one or two PASSENGERS come out and DYLE and SCOBIE enter. A young GIRL starts in after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches out and presses the top button with his metal hand. The doors close.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) If you do anything funny, or try to talk to anyone, I'll kill you, Dyle -- here and now. Okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll wreck your raincoat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next car, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TOP FLOOR LANDING -- LATE AFTERNOON As SCOBIE follows DYLE out of the elevator. SCOBIE looks around -- there is an open door at the end of a short hall. He and DYLE go to it, CAMERA FOLLOWING. Through the door, which SCOBIE closes behind them, is a flight of stairs, leading up to a second floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay -- turn around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns to find SCOBIE's gun out of the pocket and pointing at him. SCOBIE now transfers it to his metal hand and goes to DYLE, where he proceeds to frisk him. Finding the gun DYLE carries in his inside coat pocket, SCOBIE removes it. During the following conversation he will shake open the revolving magazine and let the bullets fall out onto the floor before handing back the emptied gun to DYLE. Then he will transfer his own gun back to his good hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrugging, DYLE sits on the third step.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We wait -- with our mouths shut.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . AMERICAN EXPRESS -- NIGHT The last EMPLOYEES leave the building as the WATCHMAN locks the front door after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOP FLOOR LANDING -- NIGHT In the semi-darkness, DYLE is still sitting on the third step, SCOBIE still facing him with a gun.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How long do you intend -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said with the mouth shut.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: yawns wide.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay -- up there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gets to his feet and starts up the stairs, followed by SCOBIE. DYLE stops at the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do I knock or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Open it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: opens the door. The stairs continue up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Keep going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The view had better be worth it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . AMERICAN EXPRESS -- ROOFTOP -- NIGHT A spectacular view of the Paris rooftops and the city lights beyond. DYLE and SCOBIE come out onto a level portion of roof. On the street side, the roof angles down abruptly into a steep, slate-covered pitch, broken only by two widely separated oval-shaped dormer windows. Below these is a rain gutter, then nothing -- for seven stories.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Very pretty. Now what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll give you a chance, Dyle -- which is more than you'd give me. Where's the money?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that why you dragged me all the way up here -- to ask me that? She has it -- you know that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I say maybe you both have it! One more time, Dyle -- where is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Supposing I did have it -- which I don't -- do you really think I'd hand it over?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're out, Dyle -- right now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: aims the gun and starts advancing toward DYLE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Step back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns and looks -- there is nothing behind him but a sheer drop to the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving quickly, DYLE lashes out and hacks SCOBIE's gun hand with the side of his palm and the gun falls to the roof. Following through, DYLE punches the large man full in the jaw, but instead of falling, SCOBIE wraps his arm around DYLE, holding on tightly until his head clears. Then, to his amazement, DYLE is lifted into the air and, unable to break the bear-hold, carried toward the edge of the roof. Working his arms between their two bodies, DYLE suddenly flails them out with all his strength and the hold is broken, but at the price of his coat and the flesh on his back as SCOBIE's metal claw rips through both, a wound extending from the center of DYLE's back to his shoulder. Both men look around for the gun, spot it simultaneously and leap for it, both landing short of the mark. Now they grapple with one another, each trying to break free and reach for the gun.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Back where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- THEIR HANDS Two hands, one real, one metal, inch toward the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- DYLE AND SCOBIE The battle is going to SCOBIE whose weight and strength are beginning to tire DYLE, who is now on his back, trying to stop SCOBIE from crawling over him. He has the large man by both lapels of the raincoat in a last-ditch effort to hold him. But SCOBIE, his face horribly distorted from the strain, continues to inch forward toward the gun. Suddenly, DYLE releases his hold. With nothing restraining him, SCOBIE lurches forward, tumbling past the gun, his momentum carrying him onto the sloping part of the roof, where he begins sliding down. SCOBIE beats wildly at the the slate with his claw, trying to gouge a grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- SCOBIE'S CLAW As it slides across the slate, making a hideous scratching sound and causing sparks to fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- SCOBIE As he slides over the edge and disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- DYLE As he watches, hypnotized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- ROOF EDGE There appears to be no sign of SCOBIE. Then CAMERA ZOOMS IN FOR A TIGHT CLOSE SHOT OF SCOBIE'S metal hand, gripping the rain gutter at the very edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- DYLE Having seen the claw, he rises and walks to the very edge of the level part of the roof.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Herman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- SCOBIE As he hangs, seven stories over the street, by his metal hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- DYLE He finds it hard to believe.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) How do you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you get bored, try writing 'Love thy neighbor' a hundred times on the side of the building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns and leaves going down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL CORRIDOR -- THIRD LANDING -- NIGHT The HOTEL MANAGER is busy taping a piece of cardboard over the hole ripped in REGGIE's door by SCOBIE's metal hand the night before. DYLE leaves the elevator and goes to his own door. The MANAGER eyes him coldly. DYLE "takes" the look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The next time madame forgets her key, there is another one at the desk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles, then enters his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DYLE'S ROOM -- NIGHT He closes the door and starts to remove his torn coat, wincing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smoking on the bed, sits up when she hears DYLE moving about in his room. She goes to the connecting door, unlocks her side, tries the knob, finds it still bolted from his side and knocks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is that you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: goes to the door, throws back the bolt and opens the door. REGGIE enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leads him into her room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Didn't anyone ever tell you it's impolite to -- (seeing his injured back) What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I met a man with sharp nails.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scobie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I left him hanging around the American Express.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on -- I've got something that stings like crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REGGIE'S ROOM -- NIGHT As REGGIE and DYLE enter from his room. She leads him to the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As REGGIE goes to the bathroom, DYLE takes off his torn shirt, revealing a torn and bloody T-shirt. He lies face downwards on the bed. REGGIE returns, carrying cotton, gauze, tape, scissors, and disinfectant. She sits next to him and lifts up his T-shirt to examine the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wets the cotton with disinfectant and begins cleaning the wound. He winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She continues working on his back, cleaning it, then bandaging it while they talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they continue talking, he rises from the bed and goes into his own room. REGGIE remains on the bed, watching him through the open door as he puts on a fresh T-shirt and shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes to the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts kissing him on the neck, on the chin, on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She kisses him on the mouth. The phone rings. He tries to talk as she continues kissing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The phone continues to ring and she continues to kiss him. Finally, REGGIE reaches out to the bedstand and takes the phone off the hook. She brings the receiver up to their mouths and mumbles into it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Take off your shirt and lie down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wincing) Listen -- all I really want is an estimate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not so bad. You may not be able to lie on your back for a few days -- but, then, you can lie from any position, can't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does it hurt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Haven't you got a bullet I can bite?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you really Carson Dyle's brother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like to see my passport?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your passport! What kind of a proof is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like to see where I was tattooed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, I'll drive you around there some day. (his back stinging) Ouch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ha ha. You could at least tell me what your first name is these days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alexander.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there a Mrs. Dyle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, but we're divorced.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought that was Peter Joshua.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) I'm no easier to live with than he was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (finishing the bandage) There -- you're a new man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry I couldn't tell you the truth, but I had to find out your part in all this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alex -- how can you tell if someone is lying or not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There must be some way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's an old riddle about two tribes of Indians -- the Whitefeet always tell the truth and the Blackfeet always lie. So one day you meet an Indian, you ask him if he's a truthful Whitefoot or a lying Blackfoot? He tells you he's a truthful Whitefoot, but which one is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why couldn't you just look at his feet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because he's wearing moccasins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. Well, then he's a truthful Whitefoot, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not a lying Blackfoot?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confused) Which one are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (entering, smiling) Whitefoot, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope it turns out you're a Whitefoot, Alex -- I could be very happy hanging around the tepee.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie -- listen to me -- REGGIE Oh-oh -- here it comes. The fatherly talk. You forget I'm already a widow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So was Juliet -- at fifteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not fifteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, there's your trouble right there -- you're too old for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why can't you be serious?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There, you said it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Said what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Serious. When a man gets to be my age that's the last word he ever wants to hear. I don't want to be serious -- and I especially don't want you to be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay -- I'll tell you what -- we'll just sit around all day long being frivolous -- how about that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now please, Reggie -- cut it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pulling back) Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cutting it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who told you to do that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I'm not through complaining yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. (She starts kissing him again)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now please, Reggie -- cut it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I love you, Alex --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mumbling) The phone's ringing -- REGGIE Whoever it is won't give up -- and neither will I.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on phone) Sorry -- I was just -- uh -- nibbling on something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: speaks into the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Miz Lampert, my buddies 'n me, we'd oblige it mighty highly if you could mosey on across the hall 'n chew the fat with us for a spell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is watching her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (on the phone) Can you give me one good reason why I should?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) Yes, ma'am. A little one -- 'bout seven or eight years old. Th' little tyke keeps callin' you his Aunt Reggie -- ain't that cute?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REGGIE'S ROOM -- NIGHT She covers the phone and turns to DYLE in alarm.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They've got Jean-Louis!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That sounds like their problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into the phone) I'll be right there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) We'll be waitin' in room forty-seven, Miz Lampert -- so you just wiggle on over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REGGIE'S ROOM -- NIGHT As REGGIE hangs up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What day is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tuesday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lord, I forgot all about it -- Sylvie works late Tuesday nights -- she always leaves him with me. They wouldn't do anything to a little boy, would they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know -- it depends on whether or not they've already eaten.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TEX'S ROOM -- NIGHT CLOSE SHOT -- JEAN-LOUIS. He looks around, uncertainly, first one way, then the other. CAMERA PULLS BACK to show him sitting on SCOBIE's knee, the large man holding him with his good hand, the metal one in his pocket. TEX sits next to them while GIDEON nervously paces the floor. When GIDEON begins sneezing he takes the small bottle of pills from his pocket and downs one or two, swallowing some water.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Tex -- move the kid to the other knee or something, will you? My leg's going to sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: lifts JEAN-LOUIS and puts him down on SCOBIE's other knee.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Upsy-daisy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you a real cowboy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then where is your gun?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking out his gun) Right here -- see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you put that thing away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: at the door. GIDEON goes to open it. REGGIE and DYLE enter. She sees JEAN-LOUIS and TEX's gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She snatches him off SCOBIE's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts for the door with JEAN-LOUIS. GIDEON blocks her way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ain't no game, Miz Lampert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want that money -- now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The THREE MEN look at him, surprised by his tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause as the THREE MEN look at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The THREE MEN look at one another unhappily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes DYLE's key and gives DYLE his. GIDEON goes to REGGIE, takes her key and gives her his own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The THREE MEN file out. DYLE and REGGIE exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles, takes JEAN-LOUIS' hand and leaves. DYLE turns to survey TEX's room. He goes first to the drawer in the night table -- empty; and the bed, looking in it and under it. Then he goes to the desk and opens the drawers -- also empty. The bureau is next -- he opens all three double drawers and they, too, are completely empty. Frowning, he goes to the armoire and opens it -- shelves and hanging bar are likewise bare. Then, CAMERA PANNING DOWN, he sees the only thing he's found so far in the room -- a pair of fine cowboy boots.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jean-Louis!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Howdy, Miz Lampert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (glaring at DYLE) Who invited you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Herman, it was a happy landing, I see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd better call Sylvie -- she must be frantic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid that will have to wait, Mrs. Lampert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But his mother -- GIDEON She isn't going to be anybody's mother unless you answer some questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (forcefully) Be quiet, all of you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And stop threatening that boy. He doesn't have the money. Mrs. Lampert doesn't either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then who does?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, Herman -- maybe you do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to TEX) Or you -- (to GIDEON) Or you -- GIDEON, TEX & SCOBIE (together) That's the most ridiculous -- ! You gone loco? Listen to the man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Slowly. Suppose one of you found Charles here in Paris, followed him, cornered him on the train, threw him out the window and took the money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a pause) That's a crock! If one of us did that he wouldn't hang around here waiting for the other two to wise up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he'd have to. If he left he'd be admitting his guilt -- and the others would know what happened. Whoever it is has to wait here, pretending to look for the money, waiting for the rest of us to give up and go home. That's when he'll be safe and not a minute before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Up till now we always figured she had the money -- but you know so much about it, maybe you've got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then what am I doing here? You didn't know anything about me -- I'm the only one who could have taken it and kept right on going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's just tryin' to throw us off! They've got it, I tell you! Why don't we search their rooms?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exchanging looks with REGGIE) It's all right with us -- TEX (rising) What are we wastin' time for? Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And while we're waiting, we might as well go through yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stopping) Not my room!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong, Herman -- have you got something to hide? (a pause, then smiling) Then I take it there are no objections.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'd better exchange keys. Here's mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mine's in the door. Ariva durchy, y'all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on -- let's get busy. Who gets your vote?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scobie -- he's the one that objected.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (handing her the boy) He's all yours. I'll do Tex and Gideon. Take Jean-Louis with you -- and make sure you bolt the door from inside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Viens, Jean-Louis -- we're going to have a treasure hunt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (joining them) Oh, la! If I find the treasure, will I win a prize?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to DYLE) What should we give him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about $25,000? Or do you think it would spoil him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REGGIE'S ROOM -- NIGHT CLOSE SHOT -- AIRLINES BAG. CAMERA PULLS BACK to include GIDEON, staring down at it as it lies on the table in the center of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (eyes on the bag) Tex?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Including TEX, busy going through the bureau. He looks up, then joins GIDEON.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: empties the contents of the bag on the table, then starts examining the various items. He opens the wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside, the initials "C.L." are printed in gold.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Charlie's stuff?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Looks like it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- TEX & GIDEON TEX Mebbe we'd better call Herman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has put the wallet aside and now picks up the letter, removing it from the envelope and reading it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A broad grin from TEX. They continue going through the items from the bag.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What for? If it's not here, why bother him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if it is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a pause) Why bother him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You sure nuthin's missin'?

dialogue.raw_text: The stamp market, of course -- it is here every Thursday afternoon. This is where Jean-Louis trades his -- REGGIE (as it dawns) Good Lord! The stamps! Where is he? Sylvie -- we've got to find him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter, cherie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those stamps -- they're worth a fortune!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumping up) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A fortune! Hurry -- we've got to find him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- REGGIE AND SYLVIE As they stop among the booths, looking around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They go off in opposite directions.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't see him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We will separate -- you look over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- REGGIE As she hurries along a row of stalls, weaving around small groups of MEN standing together, showing each other stamps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- SYLVIE Searching in another section of the market.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling) Jean-Louis -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- REGGIE Spotting a BOY, she runs to him and spins him around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it isn't.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jean-Louis!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- SYLVIE Looking everywhere. Suddenly she sees something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- GROUP OF MEN -- THEIR LEGS Only a small boy's elbow and part of his arm show, the rest hidden by all the legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- SYLVIE She recognizes him from these fragments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rushes to him, CAMERA PANNING WITH HER. JEAN-LOUIS stands looking at some stamps. SYLVIE grabs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smiling, JEAN-LOUIS holds up an enormous sack of assorted stamps -- hundreds of them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jean-Louis!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jean-Louis -- les timbres -- ou sont- ils?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, zut! (calling) Reggie -- Reggie -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: runs up and joins them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jean-Louis -- thank heavens! Do you have -- ! (spotting the sack of stamps) What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A man traded with me -- all those for only four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no! What man, Jean-Louis --  where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks in one direction, then in the other, trying to remember.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all run off down the line of booths. JEAN-LOUIS stops and points off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Vite, mon ange -- vite!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: La bas -- Monsieur Felix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Il est la!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- STAMP BOOTH Closed, deserted, empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- REGGIE, SYLVIE AND JEAN-LOUIS JEAN-LOUIS But he is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes to the closest booth and shakes the coat sleeve of the proprietor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before he can finish, SYLVIE, who has heard THEOPHILE, has JEAN-LOUIS by the hand, dragging him off at full speed, REGGIE right alongside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't blame him. Jean-Louis -- do you know where this Monsieur Felix lives?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- but I will ask.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Monsieur Theophile -- THEOPHILE Oui, jeune homme?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Monsieur Felix, ou habite-il?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Montmartre -- demande a Monsieur August au Bar des Artistes -- Place Blanche.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merci, Monsieur Theophile. (returning to REGGIE and SYLVIE) He says to ask Monsieur August at the --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . FELIX'S ROOM -- DUSK A bare, unkempt little room. FELIX, a man in his sixties, sits at a table, smoking a pipe. There are stamps and albums everywhere. He holds a magnifying glass in his hand, busy studying something on the table. There is a KNOCK. He looks up. Another KNOCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens and REGGIE, followed by SYLVIE and JEAN-LOUIS, enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gestures for REGGIE to come closer. Together with SYLVIE and JEAN-LOUIS, she goes to the table and looks at the stamps.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Entrez.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Monsieur Felix -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (without looking up) I was expecting you. You are American too, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at SYLVIE) Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The man who bought them last week was American. I did not see him but I heard. I knew you would come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at them, Madame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- STAMPS Four of them -- a red, a yellow, a blue, and a green, still attached to the portion of the torn envelope.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Have you ever, in your entire life, seen anything so beautiful?
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: REGGIE, FELIX, SYLVIE AND JEAN-LOUIS REGGIE

direction.raw_text: -- REGGIE, FELIX, SYLVIE AND JEAN-LOUIS REGGIE I'm -- I'm sorry -- I don't know anything about stamps.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I know them as one knows his own face, even though I have never seen them. This yellow one -- a Swedish four shilling -- called 'De Gula Fyraskillingen' -- issued in 1854.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much is it worth?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The money is unimportant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid it is important.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugging) In your money, perhaps $65,000.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you mind if I sit down? (she sits) What about the blue one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is called 'The Hawaiian Blue' and there are only seven left. In 1894 the owner of one was murdered by a rival collector who was obsessed to own it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's its value today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In human life? In greed? In suffering?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forty-five thousand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to SYLVIE) Do you have anything to eat? (to FELIX) And the orange one -- what about the orange one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A two-penny Mauritius -- issued in 1856. Not so rare as the others -- $30,000 perhaps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the last one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The best for the last -- le chef- d'oeuvre de la collection. The masterpiece. It is the most valuable stamp in the world. It is called 'The Gazette Guyanne.' It was printed by hand on colored paper in 1852 and marked with the initials of the printer. (looking at it through the glass) Today it has a value of $100,000. (a pause) Eh, bien -- I am not a thief. I knew there was some mistake. Take them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitating) You gave the boy quite a lot of stamps in return, Monsieur Felix -- are they for sale now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at the large bag) Let me see. There are 350 European, 200 Asian, 175 American, 100 African and twelve Princess Grace commemorative -- which comes to nine francs fifty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fishing money from her purse) Here's ten.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: goes to his wallet for the change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands her the four stamps and her change.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Please keep it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am a tradesman, Madame, not a doorman. And don't forget these.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm -- I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- FELIX FELIX No. For a few minutes they were mine -- that is enough.
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: HOTEL CORRIDOR -- THIRD FLOOR LANDING -- NIGHT
result.heading: HOTEL CORRIDOR -- THIRD FLOOR LANDING -- NIGHT

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL CORRIDOR -- THIRD FLOOR LANDING -- NIGHT As REGGIE comes hurrying up the stairs. She goes first to ADAM's room and knocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no answer. She goes to her own door and, to her surprise, finds it an inch or two ajar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Adam? Adam? It's me, Reggie -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REGGIE'S ROOM -- NIGHT As REGGIE enters. She freezes, having seen something on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- TEX His dead body lies on the floor, the wrists of his extended arms tied to the leg of the bed, his ankles to the steam radiator. And tied around his head is a plastic, transparent bag, inside of which the suffocated man's face, the eyes bulging against the plastic clinging tight to his features, can be seen all too clearly. REGGIE enters the shot, bending down to see if he's alive. Then she sees something beside his hands near the leg of the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- CARPET With his dying effort, TEX has traced a name against the grain of the maroon carpet -- 'DYLE.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- REGGIE Astonished and horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WIDER ANGLE As she gets to her feet and hurries to the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (gasping) Dyle --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on the phone) Hello -- Balzac 30-04, s'il vous plait -- (waiting) Mr. Bartholomew! Thank God you're there! Tex is dead, Mr. Bartholomew -- smothered -- and Adam did it -- he killed them all!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: his face lathered for a shaving, is on the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Just a minute, Mrs. Lampert -- you'd better give that to me slowly. Who's Adam?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) The one who said he was Dyle's brother -- of course I'm sure -- Tex wrote the word 'Dyle' before he died. He's the murderer I tell you -- he's the only one left! You've got to do something!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) Calm down, Mrs. Lampert -- please. Does he have the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) No, I do -- it was the stamps on that letter Charles had with him on the train. They were in plain sight all the time, but no one ever bothered looking at the envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) The envelope -- imagine that.  Mrs. Lampert, listen to me -- you're not safe as long as you've got these stamps. Go to the Embassy right away -- wait, I'd better meet you halfway -- it's quicker. Now, let's see -- do you know the center garden at the Palais Royal? -- yes, by the colonnade -- as soon as you can get there. Hurry, Mrs. Lampert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) Yes, I'm leaving now -- goodbye. She hangs up, looks briefly at TEX's body, shudders, then hurries to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL CORRIDOR -- THIRD LANDING -- NIGHT As REGGIE leaves her room and goes to the elevator. She presses the button, then notices it is in use. She goes to the stairs and starts down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL STAIRCASE -- NIGHT Between the landings. The stairs curve around the open elevator shaft. As REGGIE comes down the stairs, the cage rises into view. Inside is ADAM. For a moment, she stops and their eyes meet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie -- the stamps -- what've you done with --?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: starts running downstairs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you going? Wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: pushes the emergency stop button and then starts the cage down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL CORRIDOR -- SECOND LANDING -- NIGHT As REGGIE comes off the stairs, passes the elevator gate and starts down toward the lobby, the cage a few feet behind her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL CORRIDOR -- FIRST LANDING -- NIGHT As REGGIE continues to run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL STAIRWAY -- NIGHT Between the first landing and the lobby. REGGIE running, the elevator following.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie -- stop!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? So you can kill me too? Tex is dead, I've seen him! He said Dyle did it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not Dyle -- you know that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But Tex didn't -- he still thought -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be an idiot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reaches the lobby first and, without hesitation, races toward the front door and out. The confused hotel MANAGER behind the desk can only stare in surprise. The elevator, ADAM inside, has not yet reached the bottom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie -- ! I want those stamps!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL LOBBY -- NIGHT A taxi stands by the curb. REGGIE leaves the hotel and runs to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calmly, the DRIVER points to the little printed sign on his windshield reading "ITALIE."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks around and sees ADAM come out of the hotel and straight toward her. She turns and runs off toward the Place St. Michel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating the direction) Palais Royal -- vite!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing the other way) Porte d'Italie, moi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mais c'est tres vite! On veut me teur!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking his head) Italie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MICHEL -- NIGHT As REGGIE comes to the corner. She stops, sees the Metro station ("St. Michel") and rushes to it, scampering down the stairs. ADAM is behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MICHEL METRO STATION -- NIGHT REGGIE comes flying down the stairs and runs past the ticket booth, fishing in her bag for her carnet (booklet of tickets), casting a quick look behind her. CAMERA PANS QUICKLY TO ADAM just coming off the stairs, who runs after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO TICKET GATE -- NIGHT REGGIE gets to the gate ahead of ADAM and manages to crowd in front of some OTHERS about to pass through. Barely stopping, she holds out her ticket to the GUARD to be punched, then heads down the platform, still running. ADAM gets to the gate but the GUARD stops him as he tries to pass through.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Billet, Monsieur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breathless) I don't want to go anywhere -- I'm only trying -- GUARD (pointing off) Billet, Monsieur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: tries to look past him, to see REGGIE, but gives it up and goes back toward the ticket booth, on the run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as she runs -- the passageway is nearly empty. Her footsteps echo against the tile and concrete walls.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: METRO PASSAGEWAY -- NIGHT CAMERA LEADING REGGIE

direction.raw_text: -- PASSAGEWAY WALL (TRAVELING) The jumble of advertising posters as it passes rapidly, forming a moving band of letters, women, cartoons and colors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops and pauses for a moment at a sign indicating two different directions, an arrow for each.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Pte D'ORLEANS Pte DE CLIGNANCOURT-------" Choosing "Clignancourt," she runs off. CAMERA PANS SHARPLY, 180 degrees, to pick up ADAM rounding the corner in hot pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: starts down the platform, looking behind her every few steps.  Suddenly she looks up in surprise -- there, across the tracks on the opposite platform is ADAM.  He has evidently made the wrong turn back in the passageway. They stare at each other for a moment.  Then the bell rings, announcing the arrival of a train. ADAM turns, running back through the exit behind him. Not knowing what to do, REGGIE looks into the darkness of the tunnel. The approaching train can be heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to look at the gate -- slowly, the pneumatic door starts to close. As it does, the train roars into the station.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to herself) Come on -- please --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . METRO PASSAGEWAY -- NIGHT The gate can be seen slowly closing. ADAM runs to it, tries to force it back but cannot. Finally, he jumps up and, commando style, vaults over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is just entering the red center car (the two on either side are dark green). ADAM runs for the red car and just manages to make it as the doors shut in unison, the latches falling with a concerted click and the little whistle blowing to inform the motor-man to depart. The train starts to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO CAR -- NIGHT The entire length of the car separates ADAM and REGGIE. For a moment, their eyes meet, then ADAM starts to weave his way past the other PASSENGERS, on his way to her. Suddenly, he is stopped. ADAM turns to see a TRAIN GUARD.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Billet, Monsieur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shows him his yellow ticket and starts past him, but again the TRAIN GUARD stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tries to pull away from the TRAIN GUARD and finds himself staring into the serious face of a GENDARME.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Vous etes dans le premier classe, Monsieur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (heavy accent) This car is for first class only -- you have a second-class ticket.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But that's what they gave me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Monsieur -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at the GENDARME, then at REGGIE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "PALAIS-ROYAL" METRO PLATFORM -- NIGHT As the TRAIN pulls in and comes to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO CAR -- NIGHT The GENDARME opens the door for ADAM and escorts him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns once more to look at REGGIE as he goes. She remains in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO PLATFORM -- NIGHT The GENDARME gestures for ADAM to enter the green, second- class car behind the red, first-class one. Reluctantly, ADAM does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO CAR -- NIGHT As ADAM enters and goes to the door through which he can see REGGIE in the car ahead. She is gone. Moving quickly, he returns to the exit door and looks at the platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO PLATFORM -- NIGHT From ADAM'S P.O.V. She is hurrying toward an exit marked "SORTIE."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Featuring ADAM as he hurries from the car. He finds his way blocked by FIVE NUNS in large, white butterfly hats. It takes him a few precious seconds to work his way around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO SORTIE -- NIGHT REGGIE has entered an area leading to the exit. But as she reaches the stairway leading up to the street level, she is confronted with an iron grill barring her way. She tries to open it, but it is firmly padlocked. A sign hung on it reads "FERME LES WEEKENDS." She turns, desperately looking for some way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is off the train. He stands on the platform as the train doors slam shut, the latches click, the whistle blows and the train pulls out. He looks around in all directions, looking for some sign of REGGIE. He spots the exit marked "SORTIE" (the same one used by REGGIE) and starts toward it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO SORTIE -- NIGHT As ADAM enters the deserted area. There is, miraculously, no sign of REGGIE. He goes to the locked grill and tries it, testing the padlock. CAMERA PANS to a phone booth (solid door with a window in the upper half) and we see REGGIE's hand reaching up to dial a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits on the floor of the booth, dialing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She holds the receiver to her ear. The number can be heard ringing but no one answers. She hangs up and reaches for the phone book, leafing through its pages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INT. METRO SORTIE -- NIGHT ADAM stands for a minute, looking around, not knowing what to do.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to herself, as she dials) Balzac 3 - 0 - 0 - 4.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Embassies -- embassies --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: has finished dialing her number and now pushes the button. It clicks loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INT. EMBASSY SWITCHBOARD -- NIGHT An OPERATOR speaking into a headset.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shh. (into the phone, whispering) American Embassy? Mr. Bartholomew's office, please -- Mr. Bartholomew's office --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could you speak out, please? I can't quite hear you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) No, I can't speak any louder -- Hamilton Bartholomew -- B as in -- uh -- Bartholomew -- that's right, and the rest as in Bartholomew!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) I'm sorry, but Mr. Bartholomew has left for the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) But someone's trying to kill me -- you've got to send word to him -- in the center garden of the Palais Royal, by the colonnade -- tell him I'm trapped in a phone booth, below him in the Metro station. And my name's Lampert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) All right, Mrs. Lampert -- I'll see what I can do. Goodbye. She unplugs the call, plugs in another one and dials quickly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Mr. Bartholomew? -- there was a call for you just now, Mr. Bartholomew -- it sounded quite urgent -- a Mrs. Lampert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BARTHOLOMEW'S STUDY -- NIGHT It is a man we've never seen before, the physical opposite of the old BARTHOLOMEW.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lampert? I don't know any Mrs. Lampert -- trapped in a Metro station? Who does she think I am, the C.I.A.? All right, you'd better call the French police.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . METRO SORTIE -- NIGHT MED. SHOT -- PHONE BOOTH. As REGGIE's head appears, peeking cautiously over the bottom of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From inside the phone booth. Through the glass ADAM can be seen, leaving the Sortie area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- PHONE BOOTH Carefully, REGGIE opens the door and comes out. She goes to the corner and looks around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO PLATFORM -- NIGHT From REGGIE'S P.O.V. as ADAM walks away from CAMERA, down the platform. CAMERA PANS TO REGGIE, peeking around the corner. She looks the opposite way, sees another exit at the other end of the platform (also marked "SORTIE"). She looks back once more at ADAM, then makes up her mind and starts running towards the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- ADAM As the bell rings announcing the next train. He turns to look and sees REGGIE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes off, running after her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling) Reggie -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- REGGIE As she runs, ADAM several yards behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns into the exit.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in b.g., calling) Reggie -- wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . METRO STAIRWAY -- NIGHT As REGGIE starts up the long, steep flight of stone steps leading to the street level. ADAM appears behind her, climbing two at a time and gaining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is rapidly closing the gap between them. It is clear that REGGIE is tiring.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie -- why won't you listen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm through listening to you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I didn't kill anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then who did? You're the only one left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: descending the stairs, stand aside to let the two strange Americans pass, watching in wonderment. ADAM is only a few steps behind now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As REGGIE wearily gains the top, ADAM lunges for her. He manages to grab her foot as he falls forward, but all he winds up with is a shoe which has come loose in his hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie -- please believe me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shrieks, then regaining her balance, continues running, limping in her one shoe. ADAM scrambles to his feet and starts after her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . METRO TICKET BOOTH AREA -- NIGHT As REGGIE, still hobbling, runs through and toward the stairs, leading to the street. CAMERA PANS TO ADAM, as he, too, runs through. He is again several yards behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PLACE PALAIS ROYAL -- NIGHT As REGGIE comes up the stairs from the Metro. She stops long enough to kick off her other shoe, then runs across the street, ignoring the traffic, toward the Rue de Valois (which forms one side of the Palais Royal). ADAM is gaining on her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PALAIS ROYAL COURTYARD -- COLONNADE -- NIGHT The smaller court at the Comedie-Francaise end of the Palais gardens, separated from the larger garden by a double peristyle consisting of two twin rows (these separated from each other by a small marble court) of twenty columns each -- in all, eighty columns. The only person in sight is the man we have known as BARTHOLOMEW, waiting at the far end of the columns, looking at his watch impatiently. Then, from the Rue de Valois side of the Palais, REGGIE runs into the court. She spots "BARTHOLOMEW" and fishes in her bag for the stamps as she runs, taking them out and waving them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Bartholomew -- he's chasing me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: has run into the court and now skids to a stop at the near end of the colonnade as he spots "BARTHOLOMEW." REGGIE, still running, is halfway between the two men. "BARTHOLOMEW" draws his gun but can't get a shot at ADAM, who has ducked in among the columns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This news hits REGGIE hard and she stops, in alarm.

direction.raw_text: She looks at "BARTHOLOMEW," then back at ADAM, who has drawn his own gun. (NOTE: Both "BARTHOLOMEW" and ADAM are in among the stone columns at opposite ends of the colonnade, keeping out of each other's sight. REGGIE stands out in the open, the stamps in her hand, confused as to which man she should go to).

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie -- stop! That's Carson Dyle!

direction.raw_text: looks at one, then the other, not knowing what to do.

dialogue.raw_text: Tex recognized him -- that's why he said Dyle. If you give him those stamps, he'll kill you too!

dialogue.raw_text: Because he'd have to come out to get the stamps -- he knows he'd never make it.

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter with you, Mrs. Lampert? Are you going to believe every lie he tells you? He wants the money for himself -- that's all he's ever wanted.

dialogue.raw_text: (to ADAM, explaining) He's -- with the C.I.A. -- I've seen him at the Embassy.

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be a fool! He's Carson Dyle!

dialogue.raw_text: That's right, Mrs. Lampert -- I'm a dead man -- look at me.

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know who anybody is any more!

dialogue.raw_text: Reggie -- listen to me!

dialogue.raw_text: Can I really believe you this time, Adam?

dialogue.raw_text: All right, Adam.

dialogue.raw_text: (now called CARSON) Maybe not -- but it takes a lot of bullets to kill me. They left me there with five of them in my legs and my stomach -- they knew I was still alive but they left me. I spent ten months in a German camp -- with nothing to stop the pain and no food -- they were willing to take all these chances for the money, but not for me. They deserved to die!
dialogue.name: dialogue

At mid-stage, CAMERA PANS DOWN to his feet, only a few inches from the prompter's box. Inside, huddling down, is a terrified REGGIE, holding her breath as she watches him.
